intro: Cirrhopetalum dolichoblepharon, commonly known as the long-eyed cirrhopetalum, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, elongated petals that resemble the shape of an eye, giving it its distinctive common name. The plant belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is known for its intricate floral structure and vibrant coloration. Its flowers typically bloom in clusters, producing a showy display that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural environment.
